step1.sentence: When her team believed in the mission, they were ready to move mountains to make the product launch a success.

step2.story: The young engineer stayed up three nights in a row to fix the critical system failure before the deadline. Everyone said it was impossible, but she moved mountains and got it done. Her colleagues were speechless when the system came back online right on time.

step3.story: No one believed the small nonprofit could raise enough funds to rebuild the flood-damaged school in just six weeks. The founder, a former teacher named Marcus, refused to accept defeat. He called in every favor, organized community drives, and rallied donors from across the country. His volunteers worked weekends without pay, driven by nothing but conviction. Together, they moved mountains — and when the school reopened its doors, every child who walked in carried a story of what ordinary people can do when they refuse to give up.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 산을 옮기다 — 물리적으로 거대한 산을 이동시킨다는 뜻.
meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 '불가능해 보이는 일을 기어이 해내다'라는 의미로 쓰이며, 강한 의지나 엄청난 노력을 강조할 때 사용한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 성경(마태복음 17:20)에서 유래한 표현으로, '겨자씨만한 믿음이 있으면 산을 옮길 수 있다'는 구절에서 비롯되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 열심히 한다는 뜻을 넘어, 거의 기적에 가까운 수준의 성취를 이뤄낼 때 쓰는 과장 표현으로, 긍정적이고 감탄하는 어조를 담고 있다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She would move mountains to protect her children.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀는 아이들을 지키기 위해서라면 불가능한 일도 해낼 것이다.
